availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Jennings Landram (Garrard County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier)

body.p: Garrard County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Married Sarah A. Walker on November 2, 1848. Father of Mary Landram, William W. Landram, Addie E. Landram, Sallie Logan Landram, and Ella B. Landram. Elector in Garrard County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Garrard County in 1850. Clerk in Lancaster, Kentucky in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Lancaster in 1860. Served in the 19th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel from January 2, 1862 to January 26, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, District 2, p. 287A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, District 2, p. 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 1.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 16.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000183256, p. 51.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 323.
